response.overview: Peace River Rising offers an intimate view of the connection between violence against Indigenous women and violence against the land. In this short documentary, we see Fort St. John, B.C. and the breathtaking surroundings of the Peace River region through the eyes of Helen Knott, a Dane-Zaa/Nehiyaw social worker, poet and activist. Helen takes us through the dramatic changes she’s witnessed in her home territory. Woodlands she explored as a child have disappeared to make way for pipelines and housing developments to accommodate the influx of transient workers. Contamination from industrial endeavours has turned traditional activities — like berry picking — into potential hazards.
response.title: Peace River Rising
